Associating Issues

If you have installed TeamTrack SourceBridge or Tracker TrackerLink, you can associate issues from the Check In, Check Out, Lock, and Add Workfiles dialog boxes by clicking the Associate Issues button. You can do the following:

  • Associate issues with files and revisions on check in, check out, lock, and when adding workfiles
  • Submit new issues
  • Update or close existing issues
  • Apply version labels containing issue numbers when checking in or adding workfiles.

In addition, TrackerLink allows you to check your Serena Tracker In Tray and run saved queries from within Version Manager.

Accessing SourceBridge

To use SourceBridge, you must have Tracker TrackerLink or TeamTrack SourceBridge installed. If you do not have either installed, the Associate Issues button will not be available. Note that SourceBridge is not available on UNIX.

To access SourceBridge, click the Associate Issues button from the Check In, Check Out, Lock, or Add Workfiles dialog boxes. The first time you click the Associate Issues button within a Version Manager project database, you will be required to log in to your Tracker project.

Note that SourceBridge is invoked automatically if you have set up SourceBridge options to require that you associate issues when checking in, checking out, adding files, or locking revisions.

Complete help for Tracker TrackerLink and TeamTrack SourceBridge is available from the Help buttons on the associate dialog boxes.
